results.title: Look back in anger
results.creator_credit: Tony Richardson, Harry Saltzman and Woodfall Film Productions
results.brief_description: Attacking the issues of established values, “Look back in anger” is an explosive sex-charged film based on the play written by John Osborne that managed to shock the world in its day. Jimmy Porter (Richard Burton) a university student and jazz musician married to Allyson (Mary Ure), struggles to contain his rage in a society constrained in values. His wife bears the brunt of his intense anger and abusive manner but also his passion. When Helena (Claire Bloom) enters the scene, the heady and intense lives of Jimmy and Allyson reach a powerful climax. An intense drama that beautifully examines the social morals of a culture on the verge of change. Cast includes: Richard Burton, Mary Ure, Claire Bloom, Edith Evans, Gary Raymond, Glen Blam Shaw, Phyllis Neilson-Terry, Donald Pleasence and George Devine.

results.title: Look at Wales
results.brief_description: A selection of the tourist attractions in the towns, villages and countryside of Wales. Includes scenes of the Royal National Eisteddfod, and landscapes of mountain and valley contrasted with the bustling civic centre of Cardiff.

results.title: Look at me when I'm talking to you (NP)
results.creator_credit: Mark Davis, Open Learning Agency of Australia, Monash University and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Everybody’s business: management in action (NP)”.
How important are the skills of: self-awareness, effective listening, goal setting, providing feedback, discipline, delegation, and persuasion in the management process? How do managers acquire and use these skills to improve their managerial performance and communications skills? This episode focusses on interpersonal skills such as these.

results.title: Look at me
results.brief_description: This video graphically illustrates in dramatic style the problem facing a teenager whose dog is run over and in urgent need of help. Nick is hearing impaired. An alert young man with limited speech, he is devastated when his dog, Smoky, his closest friend, is run over. In his efforts to get help he grabs Gavin, a passing cyclist, and desperately tries to make him understand his problem; but Gavin thinks Nick is a “right Wally”. “Look at Me” is a compelling introduction into the everyday problems facing the hearing impaired.

results.title: Look at life: under your feet
results.creator_credit: Rank Film Productions and British Information Services
results.brief_description: An unusual angle on London indicating the wealth of history concealed under crowded streets. Looks at many of the underground services which play an important role in the life of the city; the great electricity tunnels under the Battersea Power Station and the Thames; the water mains and the labyrinth sewers; the Postal Service tube railways; the Chancery Lane silver vaults; and a 700 year old carmelite crypt. Narrated by Tim Turner.

results.title: Look at life: Bronze silver and gold
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Look at Life”.
Duke of Edinburgh Award’s scheme achievement through personal endeavour. Various skills are learnt by participating in various activities by young people for which they receive awards of medals - bronze, silver and gold.

results.title: Look alive!
results.brief_description: Designed to motivate an awareness of electrical safety amongst tradespeople, the film is fast-paced and amusing rather than merely instructional. It covers the use of protective clothing, safety equipment, power tools and safety procedures.
